{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Too often we think of climate change as an \nabstraction, something that will happen in the far-off future.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 16, 'start_offset': 9}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "But for \nAmerica's farmers and ranchers, climate change is already a daily \nreality."}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Extreme weather events, including record high temperatures and \ndrought in parts of our country, threaten crop productivity, stress \nwater supplies, and increase wildfire risks, while more frequent and \nintense storms in other areas wash away the soil and increase flooding.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nCollectively, these events negatively impact our crops and the soil and \nwater resources we depend on.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'They also threaten livestock, wildlife, \npeople, national food security, and our economy.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 34, 'start_offset': 12}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 58, 'start_offset': 56}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 95, 'start_offset': 92}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 101, 'start_offset': 97}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Within just the past 22 years, we have experienced 20 of the \nhottest years on record (WMO, 2019).'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Increased temperatures are \npredicted to impact crop yields and germination and harvest timing.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 101, 'start_offset': 80}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nThese impacts may be positive or negative depending on the crop and \nlocation (Roesch-McNally et al.,'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 4, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '2019).'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 62, 'start_offset': 39}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Whereas some crops might \nbenefit from a longer growing season, the species and varieties of \ncrops grown in an area shift, resulting in the need for new equipment, \nknowledge, and resources to maintain viability.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Other impacts include \ngreater risks of disease, insect, and weed pressures due to higher \ntemperatures, longer growing seasons, and more frost-free days, which \nwill increase dependence on inputs such as fungicides, herbicides, and \ninsecticides.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    In addition to higher temperatures, more extreme weather events are \nprojected.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Some areas will experience increased duration, frequency, \nand intensity of drought, whereas other areas will be subjected to \nintense storms, leading to major flooding.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'So-called 500-year floods \nhave become 100-year floods.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 71, 'start_offset': 64}}, 'display_name': 'LOC'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 81, 'start_offset': 72}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 172, 'start_offset': 166}}, 'display_name': 'PERSON'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 179, 'start_offset': 175}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'This makes planting and harvest more \ndifficult, as seen in the Midwest this year when unusually wet \nconditions led to one of the latest planting seasons on record (Rippey, \n2019).'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'These events also lead to soil loss from erosion and flooding of \nfarm fields, compounding water quality problems.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 193, 'start_offset': 175}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 209, 'start_offset': 195}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Other concerns, especially in western states, involve the reduction \nin snowpack amount and earlier peak flows (snow melt), which would \nreduce water availability during the growing season (Roesch-McNally et \nal.,'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 4, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '2019).'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Heavy and earlier spring rains or flood events will delay \nplanting or force farmers to perform field operations (e.g., tillage, \nplanting) when the soil is susceptible to compaction or erosion.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Major \nflooding also imperils infrastructures such as roads, railroads, barge \nlandings, and buildings necessary for storage and crop processing.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nHigher temperatures and increased drought increase stress on both \nlivestock and crops, thus requiring greater inputs to maintain their \nhealth.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 34, 'start_offset': 31}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Increased carbon dioxide (CO2) levels will have both positive and \nnegative effects on agriculture.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Additional CO2 will \nstimulate growth in some crops, such as soybean and wheat, and may \nprovide some protection against moderate drought.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 24, 'start_offset': 21}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 109, 'start_offset': 104}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 115, 'start_offset': 111}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'However, increasing \nCO2 levels will also stimulate weed growth, potentially \nincreasing herbicide use (Ziska, 2003).'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 147, 'start_offset': 142}}, 'display_name': 'PERSON'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'In addition, higher \nCO2 levels cause plants to take up less nutrients, leading \nto less nutritious feed in the trough and food on our plate (Myers et \nal.,'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 4, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '2014).'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Finally, drought and high temperatures will result in increased \nwildfire risk which threatens homes, fields, livestock, wildlife, and, \ntragically, human life.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 45, 'start_offset': 44}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 203, 'start_offset': 202}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 303, 'start_offset': 302}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 427, 'start_offset': 426}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 531, 'start_offset': 530}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 719, 'start_offset': 718}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 839, 'start_offset': 838}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Healthy, high-functioning soils:\n          (1) Produce food, fuel, fiber, and medicinal products using \n        management strategies that maintain or enhance environmental \n        quality;\n          (2) Store, filter, and release water, and thus protect or \n        improve water quality;\n          (3) Are resilient to environmental disturbances such as \n        drought, fire, floods, and temperature extremes;\n          (4) Resist diseases, pests, and pathogens, thus reducing the \n        reliance on pesticides;\n          (5) Store and cycle nutrients internally, reducing the \n        reliance on external inputs and the potential for off-site \n        movement of nutrients into the air and water;\n          (6) Store and cycle carbon and modify other greenhouse gases, \n        helping to reduce climate change; and,\n          (7) Maintain biodiversity and habitat, which is critical to \n        all above functions.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 49, 'start_offset': 19}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 67, 'start_offset': 63}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 250, 'start_offset': 247}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 276, 'start_offset': 262}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Recently, the USDA-NRCS Soil Health Division has outlined four soil \nhealth principles to improve soil function for a variety of ecosystem \noutcomes, but they also apply to building resilient agricultural \nsystems that sequester C and reduce GHG emissions (Roesch-McNally et \nal.,'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 4, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '2019).'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 129, 'start_offset': 125}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 164, 'start_offset': 161}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 188, 'start_offset': 169}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 233, 'start_offset': 230}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'This \napproach has been embraced and successfully deployed by many \nstakeholders at the state and national level here in the U.S. and on a \nglobal scale through FAO and the Global Alliance for Climate Smart \nAgriculture, of which SfL is an active member.'}}

{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'It recognizes that the key to engaging and \nempowering famers to act is to begin by focusing on economically viable \nsystems and practices that benefit the famer, improve resilience and \nsimultaneously deliver high value ecosystems services that the public \nseeks.'}}

{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'When new activities are implemented, farms then have \n        the data to understand the impact of their change in management \n        practices.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 105, 'start_offset': 85}}, 'display_name': 'PERSON'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 128, 'start_offset': 116}}, 'display_name': 'PRODUCT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 226, 'start_offset': 221}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 248, 'start_offset': 238}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 268, 'start_offset': 254}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n    \\8\\ Danone North America relies on EcoPractices to establish \napplication program interfaces (APIs) with various measurement tools \nsuch as Field to Market, COMET-Farm, and Cool Farm Tool.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'We remain \nflexible to improve and adjust our measurement tools should any become \nmore widely accepted.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n           Provide incentives for most impactful practices--\n        While we have initial findings that practices to improve soil \n        health can provide a return on investment to farms, the short-\n        term costs of implementing these practices often stand in the \n        way of their adoption.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Since improving soil health takes a \n        systems approach, we need to help farms financially to build-in \n        new practices so that the benefits to soil, input efficiency \n        and yields can be developed quickly in the fewest number of \n        crop cycles.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'We work directly with farms to understand the \n        financial support they need to implement new practices like \n        reducing tillage, adding cover crops, enhancing crop diversity, \n        improved manure management, ensuring irrigation efficiency, and \n        adding vegetative field buffers to help prevent water running \n        off fields.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 29, 'start_offset': 25}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 179, 'start_offset': 174}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'We are also working with USDA to incentivize these \n        practices for soil health and ideally would create contracts \n        that cover multiple practices over multiple years so farmers \n        know they will still be profitable while restoring the soil.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 33, 'start_offset': 30}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Renewable natural gas or RNG is exactly what it sounds \nlike.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'It is natural gas made from renewable resources.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 145, 'start_offset': 142}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 219, 'start_offset': 210}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Derived \nfrom methane creating by the decomposition of organic matter, \nrather than being extracted from underground fossil-based \nresources, RNG is chemically identical to the natural gas that \nmost of us use every day.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Livestock operations such as dairy \nand hog farms can be a renewable source of methane.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Manure management practices are a significant source of \ngreenhouse gas emissions in this country.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 112, 'start_offset': 110}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Manure is often \nstored in uncovered lagoons, leading to the release of methane \ninto the atmosphere which is 25 times more potent than carbon \ndioxide.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 3, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'RNG projects capture methane by diverting manure to \nlarge enclosed storage tanks called anaerobic digesters.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The \ncaptured methane is then processed to remove impurities and \nproduce a product that can be transported and delivered \nanywhere in this country through our existing natural gas \npipeline infrastructure and can be utilized by end customers \nwithout any limitations or changes to their equipment.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 28, 'start_offset': 25}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 34, 'start_offset': 29}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    The primary use for RNG today is as a fuel replacement in \ntrucks, buses, and cars that are otherwise powered by \ntraditional fossil-based natural gas.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 3, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'RNG fuel allows for a \ncarbon footprint that is lower than even electric vehicles due \nto the avoidance of farm-based methane emissions.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 25, 'start_offset': 22}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Furthermore, \nbecause RNG is primarily used by medium and heavy duty trucks, \nemissions of sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides, and particulates \nare significantly lower than those of diesel-fueled vehicles.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 27, 'start_offset': 25}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 52, 'start_offset': 43}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 68, 'start_offset': 65}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    DTE is working with 10 dairy farms in Wisconsin to develop \nRNG projects.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 38, 'start_offset': 26}}, 'display_name': 'MONEY'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'We have already committed $140 million and are \nlooking at more opportunities in other states.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 222, 'start_offset': 219}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    The financial challenges currently faced by dairy farms due \nto low milk prices combined with the additional pressure from \nlocal communities to improve water quality and reduce odor can \nbe partially mitigated by RNG projects in several ways.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 10, 'start_offset': 5}}, 'display_name': 'ORDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 15, 'start_offset': 12}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 87, 'start_offset': 84}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    First, DTE pays dairy farmers a share of the revenues \nearned from the sale of RNG, allowing these primarily family-\nowned businesses to realize value from a waste byproduct.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 7, 'start_offset': 1}}, 'display_name': 'ORDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 138, 'start_offset': 135}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nSecond, we create new, well-paying jobs in order to develop, \noperate, maintain, and support the complex systems required to \nproduce RNG.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 5, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'ORDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 38, 'start_offset': 35}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Third, the process used to produce RNG can reduce \nthe number of pathogens within the manure and thereby lower the \nrisk of groundwater contamination.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 141, 'start_offset': 138}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'And last, but not of least \nimportance to dairy communities, many of the volatile compounds \nthat contribute to odor are destroyed in the RNG production \nprocess.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 24, 'start_offset': 21}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    We believe that RNG is a unique solution in the battle \nagainst climate change.'}}

{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nIncrease Funding for Conservation Easements on Private Agricultural \n        Lands to Prevent Conversion of Agricultural Land to Development\n    The Agricultural Conservation Easement Program is a Farm Bill \nprogram that that helps landowners protect, restore, and enhance \nwetlands, grasslands, and working farms and ranches through \nconservation easements.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The conservation of privately held agricultural \nland helps prevent conversion to development, so that they can continue \nto actively sequester carbon rather than contribute to greenhouse gas \nemissions that results from other land uses.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Strategic land \nconservation can also support habitat connectivity and ecosystem \nresilience against climate change impacts.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 97, 'start_offset': 87}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 106, 'start_offset': 102}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 141, 'start_offset': 128}}, 'display_name': 'FAC'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 161, 'start_offset': 143}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 201, 'start_offset': 195}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 245, 'start_offset': 240}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Its own climate assessment estimates \nthat climate change will expand the burned areas 77 percent by \n2100, yet just days after the Camp Fire, Los Angeles County \nboard of supervisors approved a 19,000 home development in an \narea that the State had already determined is at high or very \nhigh risk without considering climate change.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 55, 'start_offset': 33}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    To avoid this moral hazard, the Federal Government should \nset as its objective that Federal taxpayer dollars provided to \nStates, communities, businesses, or individuals either pre- or \npost-disaster be spent resiliently.'}}

{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n    Natural disasters are on the rise.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'According to the Fourth National \nClimate Assessment, climate change has already brought more extreme \nweather and will continue to bring greater extremes in the foreseeable \nfuture.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 178, 'start_offset': 160}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The nation will experience a range of climate impacts, \nincluding more intense storms, bigger wildfires, and greater \ntemperature and precipitation extremes in the coming decades.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 47, 'start_offset': 38}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 94, 'start_offset': 78}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Sea level \nrise has accelerated since the 1990s and will continue to do so in the \nyears ahead.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    The costs of weather and climate-related disasters are also rising.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 66, 'start_offset': 34}}, 'display_name': 'MONEY'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The total cost of these events is more than $1.7 trillion \ndollars.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 31, 'start_offset': 4}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 52, 'start_offset': 46}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 75, 'start_offset': 71}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'For the years from 2013 to 2018, however, the annual \naverage leapt to 12.6 events.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 7, 'start_offset': 3}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 26, 'start_offset': 9}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 55, 'start_offset': 52}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 109, 'start_offset': 99}}, 'display_name': 'MONEY'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 162, 'start_offset': 152}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'In 2019, the United States has already \nexperienced ten weather and climate-related disasters over $1 billion \neach, not even counting the wildfires in California.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 9, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 45, 'start_offset': 19}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 98, 'start_offset': 95}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'This year is also \nthe fifth consecutive year in which the total number of events has \nreached ten or more.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 47, 'start_offset': 41}}, 'display_name': 'ORDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 76, 'start_offset': 49}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "These figures support the finding of the Fourth \nNational Climate Assessment that the nation's efforts to prepare for \nclimate change impacts have not yet reached the necessary scale to \navoid substantial damage to the economy, environment, and human health."}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 51, 'start_offset': 42}}, 'display_name': 'NORP'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    When communities suffer devastation, Americans respond with \ngenerosity.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 12, 'start_offset': 4}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The Congress has increasingly authorized supplemental \nappropriations to provide relief to local and state governments \noverwhelmed by disasters, to small businesses and individuals who have \nsuffered losses, and to repair damaged federal assets.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 50, 'start_offset': 13}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 55, 'start_offset': 52}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 79, 'start_offset': 58}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 147, 'start_offset': 137}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 186, 'start_offset': 164}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'According to the \nGovernment Accountability Office (GAO), between 2007 and 2013, federal \nappropriations for natural disasters increased 46 percent as compared \nto the previous six years.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 28, 'start_offset': 8}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 97, 'start_offset': 85}}, 'display_name': 'MONEY'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'In just the last three years, supplemental \nappropriations for disasters has totaled $183 billion.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 75, 'start_offset': 72}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 136, 'start_offset': 132}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "In light of the \ngrowing fiscal exposure to the federal government, the GAO has \nidentified climate change as a ``high risk'' since 2013."}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    In addition to greater climate-driven extremes, the increase in \ndamages also stems from decisions made about where and how people \nbuild.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Those decisions rest almost entirely with the states, and often \nwith local governments.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'That means that, even though the federal \ngovernment currently has comparatively little say in state and local \nchoices about land use and construction quality, it frequently picks up \nthe bill for those choices after disaster strikes.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The growing \npropensity of the federal government to absorb the costs of disasters \nmeans that state and local governments, developers, and individuals can \nbuild in riskier areas and in ways that provide less protection because \nthey believe the federal government will cover the damage when the \ndisaster occurs.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': "In other words, the federal government's growing \ngenerosity to victims of disaster creates a ``moral hazard'': \ncommunities and people place themselves at greater risk knowing that \nfederal taxpayers will bail them out."}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'In the face of accelerating \nclimate change, the federal government must reduce the incentives for \npeople to settle in at-risk areas and to build in risky ways.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 34, 'start_offset': 24}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "\n    Take, for example, California's recent experience with wildfire."}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 4, 'start_offset': 1}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 61, 'start_offset': 51}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 87, 'start_offset': 83}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nTen of the most destructive fires in the state of California have \noccurred since 2015 and the state is currently fighting a vicious \nwildfire season.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 10, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'California holds the dubious record for having more \nbuildings destroyed by wildfire than all other states combined.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 58, 'start_offset': 37}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 73, 'start_offset': 70}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'A \nrecent study has estimated it has more than 2.7 million people and 1.1.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nmillion homes located in areas at very high risk of fire.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 7, 'start_offset': 3}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 20, 'start_offset': 10}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'In 2008, \nCalifornia enacted a strict new building code designed to reduce fire \nrisk.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 27, 'start_offset': 23}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 37, 'start_offset': 28}}, 'display_name': 'FAC'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 47, 'start_offset': 39}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 61, 'start_offset': 55}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'During the devastating 2018 Camp Fire, only 18% of the 21,100 \nhomes built to older versions of the code survived the fire.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 74, 'start_offset': 66}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Those \nbuilt to the new, stricter code performed much better, but only 50% of \nthose homes survived.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 19, 'start_offset': 10}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 108, 'start_offset': 98}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    With only half of the homes built to the latest code withstanding \nclimate-fueled wildfires, California cannot assume that its building \ncodes will keep people and property safe.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 10, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'California faces worsening \nwildfire risk.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 91, 'start_offset': 88}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 99, 'start_offset': 95}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Its own climate assessment estimates that climate change \nwill likely expand burn areas 77% by 2100.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 9, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 26, 'start_offset': 16}}, 'display_name': 'FAC'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 59, 'start_offset': 41}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 81, 'start_offset': 75}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "Just days after the Camp \nFire, however, Los Angeles County approved a new 19,000 home \ndevelopment in an area that the state had determined is already at \n``high'' or ``very high'' fire risk based on past risk and without \nconsideration of the increased fire risk from climate change."}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'If those \nhouses should burn under the worsening conditions brought by climate \nchange, it could be the federal government that pays, not those who \nmade the decision to build in an area at high risk.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    To avoid this moral hazard, the federal government should set as \nits objective that federal taxpayer dollars provided to states, \ncommunities, businesses, or individuals--either pre-or post-disaster--\nbe spent resiliently.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The federal government should not subsidize new \ndevelopment that is constructed in less than resilient ways or in areas \nat high risk from climate impacts.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 79, 'start_offset': 74}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 90, 'start_offset': 89}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 149, 'start_offset': 148}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 227, 'start_offset': 226}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The government can make immediate \nprogress in these areas by focusing on three issues: (1) creation and \nenforcement of resilient building codes, (2) provision of accurate risk \nassessments to inform land-use decisions, and (3) provision of \ntechnical assistance to decision-makers.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nResilient Building Codes\n    Building codes reduce risk of damage.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 21, 'start_offset': 17}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 82, 'start_offset': 34}}, 'display_name': 'EVENT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 91, 'start_offset': 84}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 192, 'start_offset': 168}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "According to the 2019 Edition \nof the ISO National Building Code Assessment Report, Florida's \nimplementation of a statewide windstorm building code reduced losses by \napproximately 72 percent."}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 159, 'start_offset': 131}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "Effective building codes also ``have a strong \npositive effect on disaster preparation and resilience,'' as the \nrecently released National Mitigation Strategy noted."}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 6, 'start_offset': 2}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 60, 'start_offset': 17}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 66, 'start_offset': 62}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 173, 'start_offset': 171}}, 'display_name': 'MONEY'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 186, 'start_offset': 185}}, 'display_name': 'MONEY'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'A 2018 study by \nthe National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS) found that designing \nbuildings to meet the latest model building codes yields a national \nbenefit of $11 for every $1 invested.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'In light of the proven value of \nbuilding codes in reducing damage, the federal government must insist \non compliance with resilient building codes where federal taxpayer \nmoney underwrites construction.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 22, 'start_offset': 5}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    The United States does not have a national building code.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Instead, \nnon-governmental organizations, develop model codes and revise them \nperiodically.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The decision as to whether and which model building codes \nto adopt rests with states and, in many instances, local jurisdictions.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 102, 'start_offset': 54}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 133, 'start_offset': 118}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nDespite the case for strong building codes, however, the Federal \nEmergency Management Administration estimates that only 32 percent of \ndisaster-prone jurisdictions have adopted disaster-resistant building \ncodes.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 35, 'start_offset': 16}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'That means that close to 70 percent of disaster-prone \njurisdictions are at greater risk of damage, damage for which the \nfederal government will often be called upon to pay.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The federal \ngovernment must require state and local jurisdictions to use the latest \nmodel building codes when building with federal money, either pre- or \npost-disaster.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 108, 'start_offset': 100}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Enforcing requirements to adopt and comply with the most \nrecent model codes would save the federal Treasury substantial funds \nand spare local communities unnecessary damage.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Notably, virtually none of the current model codes, however, yet \nincorporate consideration of the future risk of climate change.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Rather, \nthey rely on historical risk to determine the extremes which structures \nshould withstand.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The nation urgently needs model codes that account \nfor the future risk from climate change impacts over the life of a \nstructure.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 109, 'start_offset': 92}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Estimates for when the building code organizations will have \ndeveloped such codes range to as long as decade.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The nation cannot \nafford to wait that long.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 133, 'start_offset': 130}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'As those model codes are in the process of \ndevelopment, the federal government should create its own climate-\nresilient code for two of the most damaging impacts from climate \nchange--wildfire and flood.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Those codes would apply to construction \nwhere federal taxpayer dollars are used.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    The federal government already has experience with creating \nclimate-resilient codes.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 83, 'start_offset': 66}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 94, 'start_offset': 89}}, 'display_name': 'LOC'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 143, 'start_offset': 127}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 242, 'start_offset': 237}}, 'display_name': 'ORDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 318, 'start_offset': 269}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Because no model code for climate-exacerbated \nflooding exists in the United States, the Obama administration, in the \nwake of Superstorm Sandy and based on the recommendation of the \nHurricane Sandy Rebuilding Task Force, developed the first national \nflood standard, the Federal Flood Risk Management Standard (FFRMS).'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The \nFFRMS required that where federal taxpayer money was used to build \nstructures in or near flood plains, those structures had to be elevated \nto avoid future climate-exacerbated flooding.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 8, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 64, 'start_offset': 41}}, 'display_name': 'QUANTITY'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 87, 'start_offset': 80}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 134, 'start_offset': 129}}, 'display_name': 'PERSON'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 174, 'start_offset': 169}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Ten days before Hurricane \nHarvey poured approximately four feet of rain on the Houston area \ncausing record flooding, President Trump rescinded the order creating \nthe FFRMS.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 14, 'start_offset': 9}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'With the FFRMS, the federal government proved it was capable \nof producing such standards quickly and efficiently.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The nation needs \nto take advantage of that capacity.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nRisk Assessment in Land-Use Decisions\n    Just as building codes reduce risk, restricting new development in \nat-risk areas reduces risk.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The federal government should not use \ntaxpayer dollars to support new development in high risk areas.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Doing \nso contributes to the moral hazard that those making the decisions to \nallow development in risky areas do not bear the risk of those \ndecisions.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    There is abundant evidence that people are moving into high risk \nareas.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 48, 'start_offset': 26}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 61, 'start_offset': 52}}, 'display_name': 'NORP'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'People like to live along our coasts--40 percent of Americans \nnow live in a coastal county--and alongside rivers and streams.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'These \nareas face growing flooding risks from climate change, be it more \nintense storms bringing higher storm surge, sea-level rise, or extreme \nprecipitation, or all of the above.'}}

{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'In your testimony, you discussed the role of communities in managing \n        land use and the challenges that communities are facing when \n        the available maps of flood and wildfire risk do not consider \n        climate change and the conditions communities will face in the \n        future.'}}

{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Perhaps the most important role \nis the provision of data and information.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Given the large reach of \nfederal agencies, data is key to effective decision making.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 47, 'start_offset': 43}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 80, 'start_offset': 50}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 121, 'start_offset': 116}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 204, 'start_offset': 183}}, 'display_name': 'LAW'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "That is why \nASFPM wholeheartedly supports FEMA's National Flood Mapping Program, \nthe USGS 3DEP program to collect LIDAR (topography) for the nation, \nUSGS and NWS streamgaging, and the Digital Coast Act (which focuses on \ncurating coastal data sets)."}}

{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Another role is providing leadership through promoting effective \nstandards, effective program execution, and eliminating perverse \nincentives to not be flood resilient in federal programs.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 7, 'start_offset': 3}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 49, 'start_offset': 41}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'In 2012, \nASFPM research determined that over 150 federal programs had the \npotential to impact sound floodplain management objectives; however, \nnot all of these are oriented to ensure long term flood resiliency.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'For \nexample, the tax code casualty loss deduction provides relief to \nindividuals who did not take the step to purchase flood insurance, even \nif they were required to.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 100, 'start_offset': 95}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 151, 'start_offset': 122}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'An example of a perverse incentive is the \nauthorization of a new flood control project by the USACE as long as it \nmeets National Economic Development objectives.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 197, 'start_offset': 186}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 216, 'start_offset': 205}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'This may mean, a new \nlevee that is built to less than a 100-year standard versus having a \nminimum standard or requirement for levee resiliency based on public \nsafety (for example the Netherlands uses a 10,000 year standard).'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 47, 'start_offset': 42}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 166, 'start_offset': 162}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'ASFPM \nstrongly supported Executive Order 13690 which would have required \nagencies to consider future flood conditions and adhere to a higher \nstandard than the NFIP is presently.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 54, 'start_offset': 50}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 372, 'start_offset': 359}}, 'display_name': 'FAC'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'An example of effective program \nexecution is how FEMA does not hold its on-the-ground Federal \nCoordinating Officers to account for any kind of minimum requirement \nfor building hazard mitigation into public assistance programs or for \nensuring hazard mitigation projects get to a certain state of \ndevelopment before making decisions to close or scale back Joint Field \nOffices.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 36, 'start_offset': 28}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 45, 'start_offset': 41}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Yet the policy goal of both Congress and FEMA is that both \nshould be implemented fully and expediently.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Finally, a role is to provide incentives and resources to build and \nlocal capacity in flood risk management.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The Federal government cannot \ndo it all, nor should it.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 21, 'start_offset': 11}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Too often \nthese days federal program try to be implemented directly at the \ncommunity level while states are either not included or overlooked.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'It \nis much more efficient and effective to build capacity and delegate \nauthority to states.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 2, 'start_offset': 1}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n2.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'What role should states play in assisting communities to build \n        resilience to climate change?'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Are all states capable of \n        providing such assistance?'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'If not, how could that capability be \n        improved?'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 7, 'start_offset': 6}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 54, 'start_offset': 53}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 126, 'start_offset': 125}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 188, 'start_offset': 187}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    (1) Developing more specific, downscaled data; (2) providing state \nresources through state level resilience programs, (3) developing state \nplans and standards for resilience, and (4) providing training and \nbuilding capacity at the local level.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Presently few states are capable \nof providing this assistance.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'However this capability could be improved \nthrough a mix of carrots (incentives) and sticks (penalties).'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': "For \nexample, if the availability of public assistance (by far the largest \nsource of post-disaster aid) was conditioned on the requirement that a \ncommunity had to have a valid mitigation plan as well as participate in \nadditional resiliency program depending on the hazards they face, they \nundoubtedly would do it (stick approach--currently if a community \ndoesn't have a hazard mitigation plan the only penalty is that hazard \nmitigation funding is unavailable)."}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'In fact, many more forms of \ndisaster assistance, including CDBG-DR should be tied to hazard \nresilience activities.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 2, 'start_offset': 1}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n3.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'How might states and communities use information about future sea-\n        level rise and flood risk to manage flood risk and reduce \n        future losses?'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    In a lot of ways.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 43, 'start_offset': 10}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "ASFPM and the American Planning Association just \nreleased a new report \\1\\ on incorporating flood resilience into \ncapital improvement planning (because infrastructure projects are \ntypically a community's largest investment)."}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 21, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'LOC'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 88, 'start_offset': 84}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 120, 'start_offset': 107}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 132, 'start_offset': 122}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 153, 'start_offset': 143}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Future Sea Level Rise \ninformation is beginning to be used in communities along the U.S. \nCoastline (i.e., New York City, Norfolk VA, State of California) for \nplanning and to implement both land use and building standards.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 55, 'start_offset': 21}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'It is \nbeing used by state Department of Transportation to do long-range \nrepair/replacement planning.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 139, 'start_offset': 85}}, 'display_name': 'PERSON'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 217, 'start_offset': 216}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n    \\1\\ https://www.planning.org/publications/report/9192800/.\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n4.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'How can federal programs that use a Benefit-Cost Analysis better \n        measure and integrate resilience into those analysis, and \n        prioritize mitigation investments toward more resilient \n        outcomes?'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    A couple of thoughts.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 5, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'ORDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 52, 'start_offset': 48}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "First, is that the discount rate, at least \nfor FEMA's benefit-cost analysis needs to be lowered."}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 66, 'start_offset': 58}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 91, 'start_offset': 87}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "The effect of the \nartificially high discount rate in the FEMA BCA methodology limits \nFEMA's ability to approve mitigation projects that are, in fact cost \neffective."}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 59, 'start_offset': 46}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 91, 'start_offset': 61}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 158, 'start_offset': 156}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 166, 'start_offset': 162}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'This is a recommendation recently made in the November 2019 \nFEMA National Advisory Council report \\2\\ which recommended the \ndiscount rate be lowered from 7% to 2-3%.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 6, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'ORDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Second, is that most benefit-\ncost analysis modules do not account for social impacts.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 208, 'start_offset': 169}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n    \\2\\ https://www.fema.gov/media-library-data/1576076713587-\nc1ae1017f2adb4b836ad3db0c26d 3578/November_2019_NAC_Report_final.pdf.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 78, 'start_offset': 77}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n5.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'How well do the consensus-based model codes address flood risk?'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'What \n        sorts of changes would you recommend to the model codes to \n        address sea-level rise and extreme rain events?'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': "Why do you \n        think the model codes haven't integrated the sorts of freeboard \n        requirements that are already in place in so many states and \n        communities?"}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 63, 'start_offset': 54}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    While consensus based codes have progressed over the years to begin \nto more proactively address flood risk, they are still far from what is \ndesirable, especially as it comes to resiliency against future flooding \nconditions.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 14, 'start_offset': 11}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Given that two trends we are seeing in the science is that \nsea level rise estimates are likely too conservative and slow, a \nmeaningful requirement should reflect the useful life of the type of \nbuilding which the code applies.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 56, 'start_offset': 47}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'For a residential home, this may be \nwell over 100 years.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 66, 'start_offset': 62}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'That means we need to begin to build estimates of \nSLR out to 2125 and beyond.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 152, 'start_offset': 147}}, 'display_name': 'ORDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 212, 'start_offset': 206}}, 'display_name': 'QUANTITY'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 250, 'start_offset': 244}}, 'display_name': 'QUANTITY'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Because model building codes are not land \nuse codes (how to build in a risky area more safely versus whether you \nshould be building there in the first place), the minimum freeboard \nrequirement should be 2 feet and in coastal areas should be 3 feet.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 37, 'start_offset': 31}}, 'display_name': 'QUANTITY'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nCritical facilities should be 3 feet or the 500-year elevation \nwhichever greater.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 3, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 100, 'start_offset': 96}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'One trend ASFPM is beginning to see is communities \nadopting the 500-year flood level above the FEMA mapped floodplain as a \nproxy for future conditions.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Another requirement would be to use future \nconditions floodplains especially for critical facilities.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': "\n    Model codes haven't integrated the sort of freeboard requirements \nthat are already in place in many states and communities because the \nprocess is very hard to get forward thinking ideas approved."}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'And this \nis typically due the outsized presence of the homebuilding industry in \nthe process.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 2, 'start_offset': 1}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n6.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'What are the most effective ways to assist communities so that they \n        can build resilience to climate change into their plans and \n        actions?'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 43, 'start_offset': 39}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    The most effective way is to have FEMA map future conditions \nfloodplains and include them in the package of information they give \ncommunities immediately.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 10, 'start_offset': 6}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 111, 'start_offset': 107}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 131, 'start_offset': 127}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 172, 'start_offset': 168}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 199, 'start_offset': 195}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'While FEMA has been required to include future \nconditions into their flood map updates as a result of the 2012 reform \nof the NFIP (after they had been advised by the TMAC as to how to do \nit), FEMA has yet to implement this future conditions requirement.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 30, 'start_offset': 29}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 191, 'start_offset': 186}}, 'display_name': 'PERSON'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'As \nwas answered in question 1, another aspect of this is that as a nation \nwe must have a mandatory, frequent update of rainfall-frequency \ninformation (currently the program to update Atlas 14 does not have \nconsistent funding nor a mandate).'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Another critical aspect is to help \nthem interpret future conditions scenarios.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 18, 'start_offset': 13}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 34, 'start_offset': 20}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 57, 'start_offset': 51}}, 'display_name': 'QUANTITY'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 64, 'start_offset': 61}}, 'display_name': 'LOC'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 83, 'start_offset': 79}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 111, 'start_offset': 105}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 131, 'start_offset': 128}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'For example, today, New \nYork City is planning for 6 feet of Sea Level Rise by 2100, while the \nState of Hawaii is planning for 3.2.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Why?'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'This is partially due to the \nfuture condition scenario that was picked.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Another effective way is to \ninvest in quality datasets and tools that can be used by communities.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 45, 'start_offset': 28}}, 'display_name': 'LOC'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 140, 'start_offset': 119}}, 'display_name': 'LAW'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 170, 'start_offset': 165}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'A \ngreat example of this is the Digital Coast initiative by NOAA.\\3\\ In \nfact, ASFPM supports Congressional passage of the Digital Coast Act \n(already passed by the House) which would build success on the \ninitiative.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 200, 'start_offset': 199}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n    \\3\\ https://coast.noaa.gov/digitalcoast/.\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n7.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 40, 'start_offset': 23}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'How do communities use Hazard Mitigation Plans before and after \n        disasters?'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 51, 'start_offset': 28}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'What is the relationship of Hazard Mitigation Plans \n        to comprehensive plans, zoning, and building codes?'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n    Hazard mitigation plans are typically developed prior to a disaster \nbut are hardly ever referenced after the disaster or adjusted in the \nimmediate aftermath of a disaster (which would be a best practice).'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nEven worse, there has not been a lot of success integrating these plans \ninto comprehensive plans, zoning, and building codes.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'There are \nnumerous reasons for this but one of the primary ones is that hazard \nmitigation plans are often produced by the local emergency manager and \ncomprehensive plans, zoning are led by the local planning department--\nthese silos do exist at the local level too.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 8, 'start_offset': 4}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 83, 'start_offset': 82}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 91, 'start_offset': 90}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The FEMA publication \\4\\ \nIntegrating Hazard Mitigation Into Local Planning pages 2-4 and 2-5 is \na good summary of where these points of intersection and opportunities \nfor integration exist.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n    \\4\\ https://www.fema.gov/media-library-data/20130726-1908-25045-\n0016/integrating_hazmit.pdf.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n    In an ideal world, the hazard mitigation plan, once developed or \nupdated, would be used to then feed into the update of a community \ncomprehensive plan which would, in turn, lead to updated zoning and \nbuilding code standards.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 70, 'start_offset': 16}}, 'display_name': 'LAW'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 102, 'start_offset': 82}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'A new approach, the Plan Integration for \nResilience Scorecard or PIRS created at Texas A&M University is a hands \non, facilitated approach that gets participation from different local \ngovernment agencies and uses a scorecard to identify points of \nconsistency and points of inconsistency.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'A link to a webinar on this \napproach can be found here.\\5\\\n---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n    \\5\\ https://www.floods.org/ace-files/training/\nSLIDES_PlanIntegration_PIE_Webinar_ 10.4.2017.pdf.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 295, 'start_offset': 284}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 346, 'start_offset': 309}}, 'display_name': 'PERSON'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': "All of these factors \nexacerbate respiratory disease and asthma in children.\\xxi\\ Climate \nchange-related warming leads to elevated ozone pollution, which are \nparticularly harmful to children's developing lungs and brains and \nlinked to poor birth outcomes, infant mortality, missed school days, \nand asthma attacks.\\xxii\\ Fossil fuel combustion also releases harmful \npollutants such as particulate matter, which has been linked to \npremature death, asthma exacerbations, and other respiratory symptoms \nthat are most likely to affect children."}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 8, 'start_offset': 0}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 36, 'start_offset': 26}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 49, 'start_offset': 41}}, 'display_name': 'NORP'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 287, 'start_offset': 264}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Seasonal allergies affect 10 percent \nof American children, and every spring and fall pediatric offices are \nfilled with children suffering from severe allergies.\\xxiii\\ \\xxiv\\ \n\\xxv\\ \\xxvi\\ These climate change-related elevations in ozone and \nintensification of the aeroallergen season both disproportionately harm \nchildren with asthma.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 107, 'start_offset': 94}}, 'display_name': 'LOC'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 262, 'start_offset': 258}}, 'display_name': 'LOC'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 285, 'start_offset': 279}}, 'display_name': 'LOC'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Climate change-related \nwarming has been linked to the northern expansion of Lyme disease in \nNorth America and \\xxvii\\ increase in mosquito-carried viruses,\\xxviii\\ \nand has been projected to increase the burden of child diarrheal \nillness, particularly in Asia and sub-Saharan Africa.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 140, 'start_offset': 137}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 261, 'start_offset': 257}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The decreased protein, \niron, and zinc content of certain staple crops like rice has been \ndemonstrated for plants grown under increased CO2 conditions, carrying \nsignificant implications for child nutrition.\\xxx\\ These detrimental \neffects will exacerbate U.S. food insecurity and undermine ongoing \nefforts to promote high-quality nutrition for all children.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 71, 'start_offset': 66}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'While the \nscience underpinning novel responses grows and evolves daily, we \nalready know much of what needs to be done, and simply need decisive \nbipartisan action to advance a comprehensive climate change and child \nhealth agenda.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The following are our recommendations across several \npolicy sectors.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 15, 'start_offset': 1}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 128, 'start_offset': 117}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 140, 'start_offset': 136}}, 'display_name': 'GPE'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nDe-Carbonizing the Energy Sector\n    Power plants are a significant contributor to climate change, \ngenerating over one-quarter of all U.S. greenhouse gas pollution.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'To \ndecarbonize the energy sector, comprehensive climate legislation should \npromote energy efficiency and renewable energy production at the \nfederal, state, and local levels while decreasing incentives for \ncontinued production and consumption of carbon-intensive fuels such as \ncoal, oil, and gas.'}}

{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 292, 'start_offset': 291}}, 'display_name': 'CARDINAL'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 297, 'start_offset': {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 932, 'start_offset': 914}}, 'display_name': 'PERSON'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'Climate mitigation \nstrategies focused on reforming the transportation sector have the \npotential to spur significant positive impacts on child health through \nimproved safety and physical activity.\\xxxiii\\ The best available \nscience suggests that tailpipe emissions may be responsible for 1 in 5 \nchildren who develop asthma.\\xxxiv\\ Via reduced emissions alone, clean \ntransportation is estimated to prevent 120,000 premature deaths by 2030 \nand 14,000 annually thereafter in the U.S.\\xxxv\\ Other studies have \nshown that the health benefits of lower-emission motor vehicles are \nincreased when combined with the promotion of active travel such as \nwalking or biking, which reduces the prevalence of chronic diseases \nsuch as diabetes, dementia, ischemic heart disease, and cancer.\\xxxvi\\ \n\\xxxvii\\ The overall health benefits of such transportation strategies \nhave been shown to save billions in public health spending.\\xxxviii\\ \nComprehensive climate legislation should include expanding public \ntransportation and increasing construction of safe bikeways and \nwalkways, which both reduce greenhouse gas emissions and promote \nhealthy childhood weight through active transportation.'}}
{'annotations': [{'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 59, 'start_offset': 13}}, 'display_name': 'ORG'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 372, 'start_offset': 367}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 425, 'start_offset': 419}}, 'display_name': 'PERCENT'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 433, 'start_offset': 429}}, 'display_name': 'DATE'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 552, 'start_offset': 537}}, 'display_name': 'MONEY'}, {'text_extraction': {'text_segment': {'end_offset': 795, 'start_offset': 783}}, 'display_name': 'PERSON'}], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nModernizing the Food System to Reduce its Carbon Footprint\n    Strategies aimed at shifting food systems to decrease greenhouse \ngas emissions offer further potential to address environmental concerns \nwhile dramatically promoting child health.\\xxxix\\ The adoption of more \nplant-based diets in line with current dietary guidelines could reduce \nglobal mortality by 6-10% and food-related greenhouse gas emissions by \n29-70% by 2050 with global net health benefits from diseases like \ndiabetes, heart disease, stroke, and cancer valued between US$1-31 \ntrillion.\\xl\\ In order to realize the full health benefits of such \ndietary change, evidence suggests that special attention must be given \nto reducing red meat consumption \\xli\\ and controlling sugar levels in \nmore sustainable diets.\\xlii\\ In addition, it is important to support \nefforts to improve the adaptability and resilience of our food system, \nthrough research, development, and implementation of technologies and \nstrategies that promote crop resilience and reduce the greenhouse gas \ncontributions of animal agriculture.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': '\nPromoting Sustainable Community Development\n    Climate change policies that preserve, create, and expand natural \ngreen environments directly impact the mental health of populations, \nwith the strongest benefits occurring during childhood.'}}
{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'An abundance of \nevidence suggests the relationship of public green spaces with greater \nmental wellbeing in a dose-dependent relationship.\\xliii\\ \\xliv\\ \nProlonged exposure to green space specifically during childhood has \nbeen shown to decrease independently the risk of a wide range of mental \nillness later in life.\\xlv\\ \\xlvi\\ While the exact mechanisms are still \nbeing studied, research has shown that exposure to the natural \nenvironment decreases harmful thought patterns \\xlvii\\ and can even \nimpact brain structure and development.\\xlviii\\ The importance of \nnatural environments early in life has been substantiated with studies \nshowing improved cognitive development and function with increased \ngreen space exposure.\\xlix\\ Adopting urban planning designs that \nincorporate open green spaces, walkability, reduced dependence on \nautomobile transit, and climate change resilience while minimizing \nsprawl will decrease emissions while promoting child health.'}}

{'annotations': [], 'text_snippet': {'content': 'The hierarchy prioritizes \nelimination of the hazardous agent or substitution of a less hazardous \nagent.'}}
